intro: Descurainia myriophylla, commonly known as the many-leafed tansy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has pinnately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or sandy habitats. Descurainia myriophylla is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants.
